awd_titl_txt: Spectroscopic and Magnetic Studies of Metalloprotein        Active Sites
awd_abstract_narration: Non-heme active sites are found in a variety of mono- and                       binuclear iron proteins involved in a wide range of                             biological functions.  Containing metal ion sites of unusual                    ligation and geometry, these proteins often exhibit unique                      spectral features quite different from those of small                           molecule transition metal complexes.                                                                                                                            It has been Dr. Solomon's goal to understand active site                        spectral features in terms of geometric and electronic                          structure and to define their contributions to reactivity.                      He now plans to further characterize the electronic structure                   of binuclear non-heme iron proteins including hemerythrin,                      ribonucleotide reductase, acid phosphatase and methane                          monooxygenase through the use of variable temperature and                       variable field magnetic circular dichroism, circular                            dichroism and adsorption spectroscopy techniques.
org_div_long_name: Division of Molecular and Cellular Biosciences
